snippet: As the United Nations presented the biggest financing appeal in its history, its Security Council issued a rare statement critical of the Syrian government.
abstract: United Nations issues biggest financing appeal in its history, asking for more than $5 billion in humanitarian aid for Syria to help millions of people affected by country's civil war and ease pressure in neighboring countries overwhelmed by Syrian refugees.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: As the United Nations presented the biggest financing appeal in its history, its Security Council issued a rare statement critical of the Syrian government.

headline.main: In Its Biggest Appeal Ever, U.N. Requests $5 Billion in Humanitarian Aid for Syria
headline.print_headline: In Its Biggest Appeal Ever, U.N. Requests $5 Billion in Humanitarian Aid for Syria
